title: Web Development Intern
requirements:
We're?currently hiring for Web Development Interns to join our teams remotely in Summer 2021.?? As a Web Development Intern, you will:??? + Develop and implement digital technology solutions with appropriate software design methodology in a dynamic and fast paced team environment?? + Partner with the team to perform all phases of the software development life cycle including requirements analysis, application design, code development and testing and client interaction?? + Work with modern DevOps tooling including Infrastructure as Code, Configuration Management, and CI/CD + Write automated unit, integration, and end-to-end tests that run in mature CI/CD pipelines + Troubleshoot production support issues post-deployment and create solutions as required?? + Assist in creation of technical documentation as part of client deliverables?? + Collaborate and work in an agile team environment?? As a Web Development Intern, you will have:??? + An ability to define and present conceptual technology solutions to both technical and non-technical clients while articulating the value of technology to drive creative marketing platforms?? + The ability to translate client goals into achievable technical specifications?? + Experience with hands-on development, including an understanding of applications architecture such as:?? + Object-oriented design and design patterns?? + ORM libraries?? + Database diagramming?? + Systems diagramming? + Cloud native engineering + Serverless and microservice based solutions + Experience with technology skills including:?? + Java, C#/.

NET, TS/JS or equivalent?? + One SQL database technology (MySQL, MSSQL, Oracle or equivalent)?? + HTML, CSS,?Javascript, JSP + Angular, React, Vue + AWS, Azure + Experience with source control: Git and/or SVN?? + Ability to integrate RESTful web services?? + Agile software development via SCRUM or Kanban + GitHub page or code sample preferred?? Basic Qualifications:?? + Working towards a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Management Information Systems, Mathematics, or?related field?? title: Summer 2021 Web Developer Internship
requirements:
Job Description

The successful candidate will join a high-performing team to learn more about how we produce our web products. We’re looking for creative thinkers who have a love for coding and a passion for problem solving to create consumer-facing products.

Primary Responsibilities/Accountabilities
• Create web pages using React/Node and other technologies.
• Build and develop new user facing experiences that are responsive and performant.
• Assist in implementing frontend designs for various features.
• Create support and technical documentation.
• Partner closely with cross functional teams in design, product and other business units.
• Participate in collaborative decision-making to steer product direction.
• Participate in Quality Assurance and website testing.

Knowledge/Experience Preferred
• Must be pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or related field.
• Experience in developing websites and creating web pages with React.Js and Node.Js.
• Working knowledge of web technologies (such as HTTP, HTML/DOM, JavaScript, CSS, AJAX).
• Familiarity with Git and Github for version control.
• Experience and understanding around concepts like Web Services and REST APIs.
• Understanding of Cloud infrastructures such as Amazon Web Services.
• A strong background in software engineering and computer science fundamentals.
• Awareness of Agile methodologies and Scrum.
• Proficient verbal and written communication skills.
• Sense of urgency and accountability.

Dow Jones , Making Careers Newsworthy

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status. EEO/AA/M/F/Disabled/Vets .

Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, please reach out to us at TalentResourceTeam@dowjones.com. Please put “Reasonable Accommodation" in the subject line.

Business Area: PEOPLE

Job Category: About Us

Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world’s top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron’s, MarketWatch and Financial News.

This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.

If you are a current employee at Dow Jones, do not apply here. Please go to the Career section on your Workday homepage and view "Find Jobs - Dow Jones." Thank you.

Req ID: 24119

title: Web Development Internship
requirements:
Overdrive Interactive is a Boston-based digital agency with a unique blend of strategic, media, creative and technical services that truly represent the model of what most agencies are striving to become in today's competitive environment. Employment at Overdrive means having the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment providing some of the world's leading companies with the cutting edge online marketing programs they need to succeed and grow. Our team members get their heads around online advertising, search marketing, social media, mobile, digital creative, analytics and more – all the things marketing and creative professionals need experience in to thrive in today's ever changing marketplace. Want to know more? Check out our site at www.overdriveinteractive.com

An internship at Overdrive Interactive is a foot in the door. We train our interns to become expert interactive marketers so they can work for our company. So, while getting in the door might be a little harder here once you're in, you are viewed as a critical team member and an integral part of the agency's future. The Intern's duties will encompass all aspects of web development, from start-up (design, functionality, coding, mark-up writing, and testing) to routine maintenance and troubleshooting.

Responsibilities:
• Provide daily development support for the Marketing Department.
• Conduct development research for clients, as needed.
• Work with database systems including MySQL.
• Work with off-the-shelf and open source CMS systems such as SharePoint, Drupal and WordPress.
• Work on projects including web layout enhancements, desktop applications, website enhancements, web-based applications, and database-backed websites.
• Test company websites with multiple browsers in order to maximize traffic capabilities.

Requirements:
• Senior undergraduate currently enrolled in a college or university.
• Knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
• Understanding of cross-browser issues and W3C standards.
• Knowledge of PHP programming language.
• Excellent attention to detail.
• Self-motivated to explore new technologies and programs.
• Ability to work efficiently, both independently and in team environments.
• Able to devote 15-20 hours per week at Overdrive.
• Education and experience industry standards in website development and content accessibility.
• Analytical, creative and willing to experiment.
• Ability to deal with uncertainty.
Hours can be flexible to work around a school schedule for the ideal individual. This is an unpaid internship for college credit and experience to transition onboard full-time

title: Front End Web Developer Intern
requirements:
Note: detailed application instructions at the end of the post. Do not reach out via angel.co

Are you tired of boring fintech apps? Are you interested in cryptocurrency? Do you want to learn more about the role it plays in the new economy and how to leverage that to your advantage? Apollo is creating the future of crypto trading and spearheading cryptoasset adoption by taking a user-first approach. We want to create a delightful user experience that makes users come back for more! We welcome passionate, intellectually curious and dedicated people looking to join our remote team. Check us out at www.apollodae.io.

Apollo interns will have the opportunity to advance their skills by making meaningful contributions to product development. Yes, that means your work will be shipped off to production! Aside from this, you will have the opportunity to learn how to trade from veteran traders and even create your own bots.

You’re an enthusiastic student or recent graduate with an interest in front end development. We care more about your desire to learn than your credentials. As an intern, you will support the development team in implementing design schemes to frontend code using VueJS (HTML, CSS, JS).

These are some of your personality traits:

Reliable and an effective communicator

A strong commitment to quality and deadlines

Motivated by collaboration and love working on a team

Humble and hungry to learn skills within and beyond your domain

Desire for constant self-improvement and excellence

Keen attention to detail

Your expertise comprises some of the following:

HTML, and JavaScript/TypeScript, including traversing the DOM and managing user events

Modern CSS features including transforms, animation and gradients, and some experience with CSS preprocessors such as SASS or LESS

MVC frameworks, component libraries, and UI patterns

Bonus points for experience with:

ReactJS or VueJS

Git or automated testing tools, such as Mocha or Jasmine

AWS, Firebase, JSON APIs, NoSQL datastores such as MongoDB

Nativescript

UI/UX design and tools such as Adobe Suite (Adobe XD, Photoshop), Sketch, InVision, etc.

On the job you will:

Write well designed, testable, and efficient code.

Design, code, and build architecture based on new foundation principles established by the team.

Debug issues and address performance bottlenecks.

Coordinate with product managers and designers to match visual design intent.

Integrate data from various backend services and databases.

Use time tracking and management tools, such as Toggl and Trello.

We are looking for interns who can start ASAP! Remember, even if you don’t have all of the skills listed above, but are very interested in learning, we’d still love to talk to you!

HOW TO APPLY

To apply, submit the following information to internships@apollodae.io:
• Updated LinkedIn profile link (don’t sweat this!)
• What you are studying (or have studied)? (eg. BS Computer Science)
• Sample code or repo, if available
• Date you can start working
• How long you have been working with HTML, CSS, and JS
• Details of experience with technologies listed above
• Number of hours per week you can fully commit to
• Something quirky/interesting about yourself

Intern understands, acknowledges, and agrees that there will be no compensation for this position.

Upon conclusion of the internship, which shall last no longer than six (6) months or two (2) semesters, but only for those interns with exemplary performance and work ethic may be granted an opportunity to interview with Apollo DAE for a paid position within the company if the company has the proper funding allocations for that department.

Intern will be provided a letter of recommendation that is accurate to their position, work ethic, and performance with Apollo DAE. Intern may apply for college credit and Apollo DAE will work with interns applicable school to aid in this objective.

Apollo DAE focuses on Cryptocurrency and Blockchains. Their company has offices in Colorado. They have a small team that's between 1-10 employees.

You can view their website at http://apollodae.io

title: Internship: SOLIDWORKS- Web Developer -Flexible Start date 2021
requirements: Imagine New HorizonsBe at the forefront of innovation! Serving customers of all sizes, in all industries from high-tech, life sciences, construction and transportation, we help businesses and people around the world create products and services in a novel, sustainable way.Do you have dreams? Do you enjoy a challenge? Here at Dassault Systèmes, we empower people with passion to change the world. Shape your career with 3DS! #WeAre3DSWhat your role will be?As a Web Development Intern you will work within the Documentation team for the SOLIDWORKS organization. The Documentation team authors and produces all SOLIDWORKS documentation. In this position, the Web Developer Intern will also work closely with the SOLIDWORKS Web Applications team.The Challenges Ahead...As a Web Development Intern your primary tasks will be:Completing work on a prototype web app started by a previous intern. This is a modern redesign of our online What’s New documentation. The finished app will be 100% production ready. Includes thoroughly documenting how to build, deploy, and maintain the app.Implementing a specification for a modern responsive redesign of our two main online help domainsWorking with the User Assistance manager to develop ideas and prototypes for next-generation versions of older UA deliverablesAssisting as necessary with other UA review and production tasks Your Key Success Factors…Experience in React, Express, and PostgreSQLExperience in core web technologies - HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PythonKnowledge of CAD and mechanical engineering concepts, or any experience using SOLIDWORKS or competitor CAD products, is a plus.Experience with ASP.NET, Visual Studio, and SQL Server a definite plusHighly organized with critical attention to details.Ability to work independently and within a collaborative team structure.Positive, self-motivated individual with a high level of enthusiasm and willingness to learn and incorporate coaching and instructions into daily tasks and assignments.Ability and willingness to rapidly self-teach new tools and technologies.Strong communication skillsBe in the know…Actively enrolled in a Bachelor or Master program at a college or university for the duration of the internship majoring in Computer Science, Web Development, or similar area of study for the duration of the internship.A minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0Work onsite at the Waltham, MA office locationAbility to shift directions quickly when priorities changeExcellent communication skills in English, both verbally and in writingAbility to work onsite for the duration of the internship
